My brother found this place in a guide book - it was delicious!  It was a little difficult for us to find because it is located in the fish market and there was some construction in the area.  The restaurant itself is casual with what reminded me of 80s decor.  It was also a little difficult to communicate with the waitress since she could not speak English and our Spanish is terrible.  However, we were able to get what we needed and she was very nice and accommodating.As for the food, this is what we ordered:1.  Zarzuela (seafood stew) - Yum!  One of the best dishes I tried in Spain.  It was a pretty good serving of a tomato-y sauce with different kinds of fish and other seafood.  Sooo good.  I used my bread to dip in the sauce.  My family asked for bowls because we thought it was like a soupy stew but the sauce is thicker than that.  You don't need a bowl.  2.  Lamb chops - also really delicious!  Sprinkled with sea salt.3.  Some sort of mushroom vegetable dish - also good and flavorful.After we ate, we walked through the market and had some gelato for dessert.  I wanted to come back and eat here again but we ran out of time!
